course.subject: LANG
course.name: Research Writing Skills
course.description: This one-semester course aims at enhancing the research writing skills of the research postgraduates in the Interdisciplinary Programs Office to help them meet the specific demands of their academic work. It particularly focuses on developing students' abilities in writing a wide spectrum of research genres, including proposal abstracts, papers and theses. Students who fail to fulfill the spoken English language requirement of the University are advised to take LANG 5000 before enrolling for this course (for students admitted in 2009/10 and onward).

reviews.author: wenyu
reviews.comment_content: this course is for IPO students, only a research proposal is required. There was enough time for us to finish our final work, and we did learn some technical skills in writing this kind of research proposal.
reviews.comment_teaching: we attended the class via zoom meeting because of COVID-19, and the prof. WONG is very kind, she is never too strict with students. We had 2-3 assignments related to our final research proposal, that helped us understand the structure of the proposal. Prof. WONG also gave feedback to each student and taught students 1-by-1 to correct the proposal. That is very nice.
reviews.comment_grading: I got B actually, maybe my English skill is very poor...

reviews.author: B.T.
